stories.text:
Hi HN,

In the past I've made many HTML5 web games as a freelancer, before becoming a fulltime full stack engineer. Luckily, at my current job I was given the freedom to make a wordle clone with the ability to create your own custom words.

The game is coded in TypeScript with PixiJS and Greensock for the tweens. It also has a simple AWS backend to store the user created words and map shortened urls to them. The graphics were done by a graphics artist from the same company I work for.

You can play the game here - https://words.gg/nNkbh

In order to create a custom word, click on the bulb icon in your upper right corner. You can also try a non-dictionary word. After that, you can share the custom word link with your friends.

Please let me know what you think and I'll be happy to answer any questions you have.
stories.title: I created a Wordle game with the ability to make custom words
